definition: conversely/in reverse order/in an opposite direction
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: Rooney, in turn, has created only one for Berbatov.
sentences.chinese: 反過來，魯尼僅僅助攻貝爾巴托夫一次。

sentences.english: That, in turn, improves the quality of decision making.
sentences.chinese: 反過來，這又改進了決策制定的質量。

sentences.english: In turn, the cheaper lighting has led to higher overall energy use.
sentences.chinese: 反過來，更便宜的照明燈導致了使用能源總量的上升。

sentences.english: We decided to go the other route, and we're going to tell you who all got snubbed .
sentences.chinese: 我們決定反過來說，我們會告訴大家誰被冷落。

sentences.english: On the contrary, things are always moving forward in its twisty way.
sentences.chinese: 反過來，事物的發展總是曲折着前進的。

sentences.english: That, in turn, is suspended in a transparent oily fluid.
sentences.chinese: 反過來，就是這些白色粒子懸浮在透明油層中。

sentences.english: That, in turn, means lots of big veins.
sentences.chinese: 反過來，這就意味着需要許多大型葉脈。

sentences.english: In contrast, keeping the loaded capacitance constant the loaded inductances were tuned.
sentences.chinese: 反過來，保持加載電容不變，調節加載電感的參數。

sentences.english: In turn scientists have retreated to their 'ivory towers', she said.
sentences.chinese: 她說，反過來，科學家退縮到了他們的“象牙塔”裏。

sentences.english: Instead, think back to the few times when you didn’t procrastinate. What was different?
sentences.chinese: 反過來，回想一下你沒有拖沓的那幾次，有什麼不同？

sentences.english: Instead, the seasons result from Earth's tilt on its axis.
sentences.chinese: 反過來，季節的產生是因爲地球的斜軸。

sentences.english: These in turn contribute to further analysis and correlation.
sentences.chinese: 這些反過來又有助於進一步分析和關聯。

sentences.english: Christianity, in turn, helped spread the codex throughout the Roman Empire.
sentences.chinese: 反過來，基督教也推動了手抄本在羅馬帝國內的傳播。

sentences.english: These hormones in turn affect neurotransmitters, chemical messengers in the brain.
sentences.chinese: 這些激素反過來影響大腦裏的神經遞質，化學信使。

sentences.english: In turn, the uncover map allows you to activate every teleport.
sentences.chinese: 反過來，開啓的地圖將允許你激活遠距離移動物體。

sentences.english: Turn L and enter St Pancras churchyard.
sentences.chinese: 反過來L和進入聖潘克拉斯墓地。

definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
